title: Labor unions praise Biden's plan to boost staffing at nursing homes
description: For the first time ever, nursing homes may soon have to guarantee a registered nurse is working 24/7 in every facility.

title: Paris' rental electric scooter ban has taken effect
description: The city held a referendum and banned rental e-scooters after reports of injuries and three deaths.

title: Roman emperor statue seized from Cleveland Museum of Art in smuggling investigation
description: The headless statue is believed to depict Marcus Aurelius. The investigation into its origins comes over a decade after Turkey claimed that 21 objects at the museum were linked to an illicit trade.

title: Who is Ruby Franke? What to know about the mommy vlogger accused of child abuse
description: For years, the Utah YouTube star sparked criticism for her parenting tactics. She was arrested this week after her malnourished son escaped out a window and ran to a nearby home, police said.

title: Rare painting bought for $4 at a thrift store may fetch a quarter million at auction
description: A $4 thrift store purchase turned out to be a rare painting by American artist N.C. Wyeth.

title: The front page of UNC's Daily Tar Heel was a gut punch. Here's the story behind it
description: In the midst of a school shooting, UNC's student journalists kicked into action, covering the story as it unfolded. Now, the paper's front page — a block of heart-wrenching texts — is earning praise.

title: Idalia demolished some Florida fishing communities. But locals say they'll rebuild
description: When Hurricane Idalia slammed into the Florida coast, it decimated several small beach towns and fishing villages. Now, those communities are beginning the task of rebuilding.

title: With Johannesburg's building fire, the misery of gang-hijacked towers comes into focus
description: People desperate for housing in a country with sky-high unemployment have taken to squatting in squalid conditions in former office buildings that are rented out by criminal gangs.

title: Proud Boys member Dominic Pezzola sentenced to 10 years in Jan. 6 riot case
description: Pezzola was convicted of assaulting, resisting or impeding certain officers and robbery involving government property. He was acquitted on seditious conspiracy charges. Prosecutors wanted 20 years.

title: Meet Peanut, a 21-year–old chicken and world record holder
description: Finally old enough to drink, this bantam hen had a rough start to her record-breaking life.

title: The job market continues to expand at a healthy clip as U.S. heads into Labor Day
description: Employers added 187,000 jobs in August, while the unemployemnt rate rose to 3.8%. The data indicates a steady labor market heading into the Labor Day weekend.

title: Up First briefing: Labor Day travel; 9/11 trial; best summer video games
description: This Labor Day weekend will be one of the busiest for travel. Settlement talks falter in the 9/11 terrorism case. These are the best video games of the summer.

title: Idalia's aftermath may make Labor Day holiday travel harder for some
description: NPR's Michel Martin talks to David Koenig, airlines reporter for The Associated Press, about the weekend could be complicated by fallout from Hurricane Idalia and flight staff protests.

title: Roads and airports will be crowded this weekend. Here's how to prepare
description: The FAA says this could be the third-busiest travel weekend of the year so far, while AAA warns we could see more traffic on the roads than in years. Here's what to know if you're flying or driving.

title: Whatever happened to the runaway goats of San Francisco?
description: Hmm, it's still a bit of a mystery. Here's what is known about the small herd of goats who went running through the streets in March.

title: After recent disasters, the White House says FEMA needs more money
description: The Federal Emergency Management Agency needs $16 billion in emergency funding, the White House says. That's up $4 billion from a request it made last month, due to recent disasters.

title: Remote work is harder to come by as companies push for return to office
description: Three and a half years after the start of the pandemic, employers are getting serious about increasing the amount of time workers spend in the office and trying new strategies to overcome resistance.

title: Archaeologists in Turkey have identified massive structures below a Roman-era castle
description: The multistory, below-ground structures in Diyarbakir — ID'ed by using ground-penetrating radar — may have sheltered some 10,000 people during wartime many centuries ago, archaeologists believe.

title: What has Biden started doing differently? Test yourself in this week's news quiz
description: From Simone Biles to Joe Biden, there were backflips and small steps taken in the news this week. Were you paying attention?

title: Age ain't nothing but a number but for aging lawmakers, it's raising questions
description: Elected officials are (almost) the oldest they have ever been in Washington which is causing discussions over what it means to be fit for office.

title: In the Trump Georgia case, conflicting legal strategies complicate the path to trial
description: In the Georgia election interference case, conflicting legal strategies of 19 co-defendants and the crowded calendar for Donald Trump's other court cases complicate the path to trial.

title: Understaffed nursing homes are a huge problem, and Biden's promised fix 'sabotaged'
description: A study commissioned by the government to recommend minimum staffing levels at nursing homes drew no conclusions. And that means Biden's pledge to set those minimums may come to far less than hoped.

title: New York City is embracing teletherapy for teens. It may not be the best approach
description: A proposal to establish the biggest student mental health program in the country contains a paradox. With teens' mental health struggles partly fueled by screens, is teletherapy the right tool?

title: Weeks after the fire, the response in Maui shifts from a sprint to a marathon
description: Officials and volunteers say addressing mental health needs and trauma will likely take years.

title: Canada issues travel advisory warning over U.S. states' LGBTQ+ laws
description: The country's Global Affairs department did not specify which states, but is advising Canadian travelers to check the local laws for their destination before traveling.

title: Judge: Trump-era rule change allowing the logging of old-growth forests violates laws
description: U.S. Magistrate Judge Andrew Hallman on Thursday found that the U.S. Forest Service violated the National Environmental Policy Act, the National Forest Management Act and the Endangered Species Act.
